comments.text: Led by Downey's career-resurrecting performance as billionaire weapons peddler Tony Stark, it proves just as indispensable to the movie's giddy escapist appeal as the seamless CGI effects and eye-popping pyrotechnics.
comments.author: Craig Outhier

comments.text: Robert Downey Jr. gives a nicely sardonic performance as Tony Stark, a rich playboy and the brilliant heir to his father's weapons manufacturing dynasty.
comments.author: J. R. Jones

comments.text: There are a few scenes in Iron Man that make you realize why we rely on giant studios and big budgets come the summer months.
comments.author: Laremy Legel

comments.text: A supremely confident, well-tooled entertainment. It's bound to be the early pace-maker for the oncoming glut of summer blockbusters.
comments.author: Tom Charity

comments.text: Downey is at his charismatic best, rendering believable Stark's transformation from self-indulgent jerk to socially conscious crusader.
comments.author: Calvin Wilson

comments.text: If every superhero franchise had a Robert Downey Jr., the genre might actually be watchable again.
comments.author: Bob Mondello

comments.text: Few of the films in the (MCU) are as accessible as this one, and while you may not love it in your top-ten films of all-time, you can't beat the good time this film brings.
comments.author: Colby Bryant

comments.text: Iron Man is of such caliber that it makes the other films from the Marvel canon seem lesser by comparison.
comments.author: Zaki Hasan

comments.text: Robert Downey Jr. is the clown prince of stars, a role he was born to play after allowing us to watch his candid Hollywood revels for years and years and years.
comments.author: Eileen Jones

comments.text: Still, if the film is ultimately disappointing it is in part because it begins so well, and there is a lot to enjoy before the over-the-top final act.
comments.author: Karl French

comments.text: The movie that proved it's possible to make GOOD superhero movies, ushering in the MCU and teaching DC absolutely nothing
comments.author: Leona Laurie

comments.text: It's perhaps the most thrilling tribute to good old American ingenuity the movies have given us in ages.
comments.author: Marcianne Miller
